job_seekers.resume_technology:
Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering, 2012
SEMINAR ATTENDED
In-house Seminars and Trainings (EPICS):
Construction Occupational Safety and Health
Basic Fire Prevention and Safety
Electrical Inspection, Audit and Safety
In-house Seminars and Trainings (ENGTECH):
IDS Hi-Mod GPR "Acquisition Unit and Post Processing Unit"
Qualification for Radiation Protection Officers (RPO's)
Temperature Measurement and Calibration Training
Force and Torque Measurement and Calibration Training
Balance and Weight Measurement and Calibration Training
CAREER OBJECTIVE
To be a proactive member in a challenging environment that would utilize
and further develop my skills that
Would be beneficial to the company as well as to my personal growth.
PROFESSIONAL PROFILE
Has a 6 years of project supervision in a construction and maintenance
monitoring experience. Trained in handling different contractors and
projects for supervision to ensure work progress is met within the time
frame. Responsible for actual monitoring on site to make sure it is in
accordance with the Standard & Specification.
PROFESSIONAL SKILLS
Knowledgeable in using Microsoft office Word & Excel
Knowledge in auto Cads
Responsible hardworking result-oriented and able to work in a team
Willing to work in graveyard shift and long distance travel if necessary
High potential skills and able to deliver high performance as a result
Eager to learn and a fast learner, can apply skills immediately
Excellent Team Player/Leader
High adaptable to changes in work schedules, work environment and
situations
Can handle stress and pressures as a result, being flexible
Trained to work with minimal supervision
Looking to settle for a long-term career
EMPLOYMENT HISTORY
Elekins Power Innovations and Control Solutions Inc.
September 5, 2016 â€“Present
Elekins Power Innovations and Control Solutions Inc. specializes in
engineering, construction management and construction of utility projects
like Residential Subdivision, Medical Facilities, Malls, Schools, Roads and
Commercial Centers, Hotels etc.
JOB TITLE: PROJECT IN-CHARGE-MEPFS
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Supervise all related work activities and assigned tasks being done on
site based on submitted and approved Work Sequence and Methodology.
Interprets and executes plans and Specifications
Checks work design and technical specifications if implemented correctly
on site.
Resolves the cause of delay in target schedule and problems related to
work activity.
Coordinates and monitors subcontractor works on proper execution and
compliance to Quality plan.
Furnishes subcontractors the plans / details needed as well as informing
them of the changes or additive/deductive
Works on site.
Evaluates and checks work accomplishments versus submitted billings.
Coordinates the requisition, issuances and the timely delivery of
required materials on site.
Ensures that all materials to be installed comply with the approved
submittals and tests.
Conducts "time and motion study" and documents man hour productivity on
assigned scope of work.
Ensures the proper stock filling and safekeeping of the company-owned
equipment/tools.
Prepares electrical plans and As-Built plan.
Enforces the implementation of quality plans and objectives of the
project.
Prepares quantity take off and bill of quantities for bidding
Implements all environmental, health and safety rules as well as security
regulations within my area of assignment
ENGINEERING TECHNOLOGY (ENG-TECH) RIYADH SAUDI ARABIA
January 2014-January 2016
Instrumentation Calibration and maintenance services MEPF Engineers,
roads and highway.
JOB TITLE: INSTRUMENTATION ENGINEER
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Calibration of all electrical equipment's ensuring compliance with safety
requirements and as per standards.
Coordinate with Mechanical, civil Engineers, Discuss technical standards
use for equipment calibration for successful completion of projects.
Ensure all materials are calibrated in standard process
Following higher management time schedule instructions and advices,
reporting work field conditions problems and status to higher management,
following activities of other departments in site.
Conduct inspections of equipment for preventive maintenance.
Prepare documentation for calibrated instrument
Checking the drawings and document's used at site for approvals compliance
with project requirements.
Assist and coordinate the preparation of the final handing over documents,
testing and commissioning reports, Maintaining records and archives to
company standards.
Using hand tools and power tools.
Diagnose malfunctioning systems, apparatus, and components, using test
equipment and hand tools, to locate the cause of a breakdown and correct
the problem.
Inspect electrical systems, equipment, and components to identify hazards,
defects, and the need for adjustment or repair, and to ensure compliance
with codes.
Advise management on whether continued operation of equipment could be
hazardous.
Test electrical systems and continuity of circuits in electrical wiring,
equipment, and fixtures, using testing devices such as ohmmeters,
voltmeters, and oscilloscopes, to ensure compatibility and safety of
system.
Supervising works in the fields of electrical area.
Operates and conduct scanning on site using Hi-Mod Ground Penetrating Radar
(GPR).
Processing the data taken from GPR using the IDS system "Acquisition Unit
and Post Processing Unit.
Plotting of any utilities using autocad from the processed acquisition.
Making reports, conclusions and recommendation through evaluations of the
processed data.
LBCarmelo Engineering
October 2012-November 2013
Electrical Contractor based on Iloilo province, composed of Electrical
Engineers, for Electrical designs, site implementation, testing and
commissioning.
JOB TITLE: Project Engineer
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Preparation of Electrical deigns for residential, commercial and
industrials buildings.
Preparation of Auto-cad drawings, for construction up to As-Built plan.
Preparation of load computation, voltage drop and short circuit calculation
based on standards.
Site visit and inspection during construction and meeting with clients
Preparation of Bill of materials and cost estimates.
Checking the drawings and document's used at site for approvals compliance
with project requirements.
Documentation and encoding.
Prepares quantity take off and bill of quantities for bidding
Cost and Estimation
Checks work design and technical specifications.
Meeting with clients
Evaluates and checks work accomplishments versus submitted billings.
Coordinates the requisition, issuances and the timely delivery of
required materials on site.
Ensures that all materials to be installed comply with the approved
submittals and tests.
Conducts "time and motion study" and documents man hour productivity on
assigned scope of work.
Ensures the proper stock filling and safekeeping of the company-owned
equipment/tools.
Enforces the implementation of quality plans and objectives of the
project.
Prepares quantity take off and bill of quantities for bidding.
SUPERVISE AND MONITORING FOR ELECTRICAL WORKS
Inspection of installation transformer up to 1000KVA to LV switchgear
substation, Emergency power or Generator termination synchronizing panel ,
Automatic Transfer Switch, Main Distribution Panel, Distribution Panel
Power Panel, Lighting Panel.
Internal and External Decorative light fixtures, Illumination and Dimming
system, Power receptacles, Cable routing, Earthing, Cable trays, Panel
Board and Building Management System.
Conduct testing and commissioning of electrical power system insulation and
continuity test motors, pumps and devices.
ILOILO ELECTRIC COMPANY II
ON THE JOB TRAINEE â€“ UTILITY COMPANY
April 2010 â€“ May 2010
JOB TITLE: On-the-Job Trainee
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Assist the field/site Electrical Engineers in various electrical
maintenance and programming.
Maintain the electrical supplies on the sites.
Check the electrical wirings and connections on the different departments
of the Plant site.
Replaces electrical supplies not functioning well.
Maintain the safety of the electrical connections and observe one's safety
all the time
REFERENCES:
Engr. June A Porras
Quantity Surveyor
09095709278
Engr. Alex F. Pida
Electrical Engineer
09992290844
Engr. Roberto G. Barela
Quantity Surveyor
09959046957
REYNALDO L. PORRAS JR.
Applicant
-----------------------
MrPorras CURRICULUM VITAE . 09273257939
